required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Home Hemodialysis Assisted by a Nurse for Arterio-venous Fistula Cannulation
clinical_study.official_title: Feasibility of a Home HD Program Assisted by a Nurse Coming at Home for Arterio-venous Fistula (AVF) Cannulation

brief_summary.textblock: Home HD (HHD) is associated with better outcome in end-stage renal disease patients compared to in-center HD, in particular in terms of quality of life. However fear of AVF cannulation is a known barrier for patient's choice and adoption of a HHD program. Providing nurse assistance for the cannulation can help developing HHD programs. The aim of this study is to evaluate the feasibility of assisted home hemodialysis, with the intervention of a nurse at home for arterio-venous fistula cannulation.

detailed_description.textblock:
- Monocentric prospective interventional study.
- Intervention is assisted HHD, defined as: rope-ladder cannulation at the patient's home provided by a trained private nurse at each dialysis session, and connection to the Nxstage System One
- pilot study, with main objective defined as feasibility of the investigator's assisted HHD program. Pilot study usually concerns a small population, allowing us to develop thereafter a bigger study if the results are encouraging.
- primary end-point criteria defined as definitive cessation of HHD with transfer to an other dialysis modality.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All incident and prevalent dialysis patients of our unit will get information on that assisted HHD program and will be able to choose this technique

primary_outcome.description: definitive cessation of HHD with transfer to an other dialysis modality.

arm_group.description: all patients starting assisted home hemodialysis during the study period

intervention.description: Arteriovenous fistula cannulation at the patient's home provided by a trained private nurse at each dialysis session with the rope-ladder technique, and connection to the Nxstage System One

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient must be aged more than 18, able to read and write, and have a person with him at home during HD session, according to the french law.
Exclusion criteria:
- medical contra-indication for HHD
